sen.j: 宝ヶ池駅（たからがいけえき）は、京都市左京区にある叡山電鉄叡山電鉄叡山本線及び叡山電鉄叡山電鉄鞍馬線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in the Sakyo Ward of Kyoto City, the Takaragaike Station is a stop on the Eizan Main Line and the Kurama Line, the Eizan-dentetsu (Eizan Electric Railway).
Takaragaike Station, located in the Sakyo ward of Kyoto City, is a stop on the Eizan Main Line and the Kurama Line of the Eizan-dentetsu (Eizan Electric Railway).
Takaragaike Station, located in the Sakyo ward of Kyoto City, is a stop on the Eizan Main Line and the Kurama Line of the Eizan-dentetsu (Eizan Electric Railway).

sen.j: 島式1面・相対式2面4線のプラットホームを持つ無人駅。
sen.e: An unmanned station with one island platform and two separate platforms serving four tracks.
It is an unmanned station with one island platform and two separate platforms serving four tracks.
It is an unmanned station with one island platform and two separate platforms serving four tracks.

sen.j: ホームの南側（出町柳側）に駅構内踏切（第1種甲）があり、各ホームを結んでいるが、無人駅で改札口が無いため一般の人や自転車の横断も多い。
sen.e: A level crossing in the station (Class 1 Ko) lies in the south side (on the Demachiyanagi side) of the platforms and interconnects the platforms, where many people and bicycles cross due to the station being unmanned and having no ticket gate.

A level crossing in the station (Class 1 Ko) lies in the south side (on the Demachiyanagi side) of the platforms and interconnects the platforms, where many people and bicycles cross due to the station being unmanned and having no ticket gate.

A level crossing in the station (Class 1 Ko) lies in the south side (on the Demachiyanagi side) of the platforms and interconnects the platforms, where many people and bicycles cross due to the station being unmanned and having no ticket gate.

sen.j: 踏切の西側には叡山電鉄が用意した無料駐輪場がある。
sen.e: There is a free bicycle parking area to the west of the level crossing, which was installed by the Eizan Electric Railway.
There is a free bicycle parking area to the west of the level crossing, which was installed by the Eizan Electric Railway.
There is a free bicycle parking area to the west of the level crossing, which was installed by the Eizan Electric Railway.

sen.j: 各ホームの中ほどには上屋が設置されており、2・3番ホームには待合室もあるが、現在中には自動販売機が設置されているだけでベンチは無く、出入り口の扉も撤去されている。
sen.e: A roof is installed on each of the platforms around the center and platform Nos. 2 and 3 are equipped with a waiting room, where no bench but only a vending machine is now installed, and an entrance door is removed.

A roof is installed on each of the platforms around the center and platform nos. 2 and 3 are equipped with a waiting room, where currently no bench but only a vending machine is installed, and the entrance door has been removed.

A roof is installed on each of the platforms around the center, and Platform 2 and 3 are equipped with a waiting room, where currently no bench but only a vending machine is installed, and the entrance door has been removed.

sen.j: 西側の国道側入口から鞍馬方面の4番線ホームへは少し上がっているが車椅子等での移動は可能。
sen.e: There is a slight slope from the entrance on the National Route side on the west up to the Kurama-bound platform No. 4, which can be accessed by wheel chairs.
There is a slight slope from the entrance on the National Route side on the west up to the Kurama-bound platform No. 4, which is wheelchair-accessible.
There is a slight slope from the entrance on the National Route side on the west up to the Kurama-bound Platform 4, which is wheelchair-accessible.

sen.j: 他のホームへは踏切のレール面からホームの高さまで上下する必要があり、介護者が必要。
sen.e: Caretakers are needed to go up and down the track level of the crossing and the platform level to access other platforms.
Caretakers are needed to go up and down the track level of the crossing and the platform level in order to access other platforms.
Caretakers are needed to go up and down the track level of the crossing and the platform level in order to access other platforms.

sen.j: 乗換駅であるが無人駅のため、乗換えの際は下車の際に電車乗務員に申し出る。
sen.e: Since the station is an unmanned transfer station, passengers are required to notify a train crew of transferring when leaving the train.
Since the station is an unmanned transfer station, passengers are required to notify one of the train personnel regarding any transfer when leaving the train.
Since the station is an unmanned transfer station, passengers are required to notify one of the train personnel regarding any transfer when leaving the train.

sen.j: 目的駅までの乗車券を持っている場合は、提示する。
sen.e: If a passenger has a ticket to his/her destination, show it to the train crew.
If a passenger has a ticket to his/her destination, it must be shown to the train personnel.
If a passenger has a ticket to his/her destination, it must be shown to the train personnel.

sen.j: 無人駅から乗車の場合などで目的駅までの乗車券を持っていない場合は、乗換えの際に車内で目的駅までの運賃を支払い、目的駅までの乗車券を発行してもらう。
sen.e: If a passenger gets on a train at an unmanned station and does not have a ticket to his/her destination, a passenger is required to pay the fare to the destination on the train in transferring to have a ticket to the destination issued.

If a passenger gets on a train at an unmanned station and does not have a ticket to his/her destination, the passenger will be required to pay the fare to the destination on the train in transferring in order to have a ticket to the destination issued.

If a passenger gets on a train at an unmanned station and does not have a ticket to his/her destination, the passenger will be required to pay the fare to the destination on the train in transferring in order to have a ticket to the destination issued.

sen.j: スルッとKANSAI共通カードの場合は、ひとまず宝ヶ池駅までの運賃が引き落とされ、目的駅で差額が引き落とされる。
sen.e: When using a KANSAI THRU PASS, the fare to the Takaragaike Station is deducted first and then a difference is deducted at the destination.
When using a KANSAI THRU PASS, the fare to the Takaragaike Station is deducted first and then the difference is deducted at the destination.
When using a KANSAI THRU PASS, the fare to the Takaragaike Station is deducted first and then the difference is deducted at the destination.

sen.j: 3番線ホームの八幡前側に鞍馬方面下り線への片渡り線がある。
sen.e: There is a single crossover leading to a Kurama-bound outbound track on the Hachimanmae side of the platform No. 3.
There is a single crossover leading to a Kurama-bound outbound track on the Hachimanmae side of platform No. 3.
There is a single crossover leading to a Kurama-bound outbound track on the Hachimanmae side of Platform 3.

sen.j: 以前は朝に1本のみ3番線から岩倉への折返し電車が存在したが2000年前後に廃止となった。
sen.e: There used to be shuttle trains bound for Iwakura which arrive at and depart from the platform No. 3 once in the morning, but the operation was abolished in about 2000.
There used to be shuttle trains bound for Iwakura, which arrived at and departed from platform No. 3 once in the morning, but the operation was abolished in about 2000.
There used to be shuttle trains bound for Iwakura, which arrived at and departed from Platform 3 once in the morning, but the operation was abolished in about 2000.

sen.j: また市民マラソンのための出町柳～宝ヶ池の臨時列車も市営地下鉄の国際会館延長後は運転されなくなり、現在この駅での折返し電車は異常時以外存在しない。
sen.e: The operation of a special train running between Demachiyanagi and Takaragaike during the citizen's marathon was halted after the Kyoto City Subway was extended to Kokusaikaikan, and now there is no shuttle train arriving at and departing from this station except when there is a trouble.

The operation of a special train running between Demachiyanagi and Takaragaike during the citizen's marathon was halted after the Kyoto City Subway was extended to Kokusaikaikan, so now there is no shuttle train arriving at and departing from this station except when there is a trouble.

The operation of a special train running between Demachiyanagi and Takaragaike during the citizen's marathon was halted after the Kyoto Municipal Subway was extended to Kokusaikaikan, so now there is no shuttle train arriving at and departing from this station except when there is a problem.

sen.j: 3・4番線から修学院方向に伸びる側線は、以前は複線分岐であり、3番線からの線路は下りの叡山本線から鞍馬線への線路と平面交差していた。
sen.e: The side track extending from the track Nos. 3 and 4 in the direction of Shugakuin used to be a diverging double track, and the track extending from the track No. 3 used to cross the track leading from the outbound Eizan Main Line to the Kurama Line at grade.

The side track extending from track nos. 3 and 4 in the direction of Shugakuin used to be a diverging double track, and the track extending from track No. 3 used to cross the track leading from the outbound Eizan Main Line to the Kurama Line at grade.

The side track extending from Platform 3 and 4 in the direction of Shugakuin used to be a diverging double track, and the track extending from Platform 3 used to cross the track leading from the outbound Eizan Main Line to the Kurama Line at grade.

sen.j: PTC化の際に現在の4番線からの線路から分岐するように改められた。
sen.e: When a positive train control (PTC) was implemented, the track was changed to diverge from the current track No. 4
When a positive train control (PTC) was implemented, the track was changed so that it would diverge from the current track No. 4.
When a positive train control (PTC) was implemented, the track was changed so that it would diverge from the current Platform 4.

sen.j: 国道367号に面していて、駅南側で同国道から分かれた白川通の高架橋が線路を跨ぐ。
sen.e: The station faces Kokudo 367 Go (National Route 367), and to the south of the station and over the railway tracks lies an elevated bridge of the Shirakawa-dori Street diverging from the National Road.

The station faces Kokudo 367 Go (National Route 367), and to the south of the station and over the railway tracks lies an elevated bridge of Shirakawa-dori Street, which diverges from the National Road.
The station faces National Route 367, and to the south of the station and over the railway tracks lies an elevated bridge of Shirakawa-dori Street, which diverges from the National Route.

sen.j: 周辺は国道沿い以外は山に挟まれた狭い住宅地である。
sen.e: The area around the station except along the National Route is small residential areas between the station and mountains.
The area around the station except along the National Route comprises small residential areas between the station and the mountains.
The area around the station except along the National Route comprises small residential areas between the station and the mountains.

sen.j: 北西約1kmに京都市営地下鉄烏丸線国際会館駅がある。
sen.e: The Karasuma-Sen (Karasuma Line), Kyoto City Subway, Kokusaikaikan Station is located about 1 km northwest to the station.

sen.j: 1925年（大正14年）9月27日 京都電燈の山端駅として開業。
sen.e: The station opened on September 27, 1925 as a Yamabana Station owned by Kyoto Dento.
The station opened on September 27, 1925 as a Yamabana Station owned by Kyoto Dento.
September 27, 1925: The station opened as a Yamabana Station owned by Kyoto Dento.

sen.j: 1928年（昭和3年）12月1日 鞍馬電気鉄道により山端～市原間が開業、接続駅となる。
sen.e: On December 1, 1928, the Kurama Electric Railway opened the line between Yamabana and Ichihara, thereby to become a transfer station.
On December 1, 1928, the Kurama Electric Railway opened the line between Yamabana and Ichihara, thus becoming a transfer station.
December 1, 1928: The Kurama Electric Railway opened the line between Yamabana and Ichihara, thus becoming a transfer station.

sen.j: 1929年（昭和4年）12月20日 鞍馬電気鉄道と京都電燈（出町柳駅方面）との乗り入れ運転開始。
sen.e: On December 20, 1929, an extended operation service began between the Kurama Electric Railway and the Kyoto Dento (bound for Demachiyanagi Station).
On December 20, 1929, an extended operation service began between the Kurama Electric Railway and the Kyoto Dento (bound for Demachiyanagi Station).
December 20, 1929: An extended operation service began between the Kurama Electric Railway and the Kyoto Dento (bound for Demachiyanagi Station).

sen.j: 分岐駅となる。
sen.e: The station became a branch station.
The station became a branch station.
The station became a branch station.

sen.j: 1942年（昭和17年）3月2日 京都電燈が会社譲渡で京福電気鉄道となる。
sen.e: On March 2, 1942, the Kyoto Dento became Keifuku Electric Railroad as a result of transfer of the company.
On March 2, 1942, the Kyoto Dento became Keifuku Electric Railroad as a result of transfer of the company.
March 2, 1942: The Kyoto Dento became Keifuku Electric Railroad as a result of transfer of the company.

sen.j: 1942年（昭和17年）8月1日 鞍馬電気鉄道が京福電気鉄道に合併される。
sen.e: On August 1, 1942, the Kurama Electric Railway was merged into the Keifuku Electric Railroad.
On August 1, 1942, the Kurama Electric Railway was merged into the Keifuku Electric Railroad.
August 1, 1942: The Kurama Electric Railway was merged into the Keifuku Electric Railroad.

sen.j: 1944年（昭和19年）5月1日 当駅～八瀬駅（現・八瀬比叡山口駅）間が、戦争に伴う資材供出のため単線化。
sen.e: On May 1, 1944, the line between the Takaragaike Station and the Yase Station (currently Yase-Hieizanguchi Station) became a single track for the delivery of supplies for the war.
On May 1, 1944, the line between the Takaragaike Station and the Yase Station (currently Yase-Hieizanguchi Station) became a single track for the delivery of supplies for the war.
May 1, 1944: The line between this station and Yase Station (currently Yase-Hieizanguchi Station) became a single track for the delivery of supplies for the war.

sen.j: 1944年（昭和19年）11月10日 当駅～二軒茶屋駅 (京都府)間が、戦争に伴う資材供出のため単線化。
sen.e: On November 10, 1944, the line between the Takaragaike Station and the Nikenchaya Station (Kyoto Prefecture) became a single track for the delivery of supplies for the war.
On November 10, 1944, the line between the Takaragaike Station and the Nikenchaya Station (Kyoto Prefecture) became a single track for the delivery of supplies for the war.
November 10, 1944: The line between this station and Nikenchaya Station (Kyoto Prefecture) became a single track for the delivery of supplies for the war.

sen.j: 1949年（昭和24年）12月11日 元田中から当駅まで京都市電の直通運転を開始。
sen.e: On December 11, 1949, a through train service from the Mototanaka Station to the Takaragaike Station began by Kyoto City Trams.
On December 11, 1949, a through-train service from Mototanaka Station to Takaragaike Station was begun by Kyoto City Trams.
December 11, 1949: A through-train service from Mototanaka Station to this station was begun by Kyoto City Trams.

sen.j: 近くにあった競輪場への輸送に対応するためである。
sen.e: It was intended to deal with transportation to the bicycle race track near the station.
It was intended to deal with transportation to the bicycle racetrack near the station.
It was intended to deal with transportation to the bicycle racetrack near the station.

sen.j: このため、当駅には市電用の低床ホームが設けられた。
sen.e: Accordingly, a low-floor platform was built in the station for the Kyoto City Trams.
Accordingly, a low-floor platform was built in the station for the Kyoto City Trams.
Accordingly, a low-floor platform was built in the station for the Kyoto City Trams.

sen.j: 現在も、4番線鞍馬方面行きホームの北側に、低床ホーム跡が残っている。
sen.e: Until now, remains of the low-floor platform still exist to the north of the Kurama-bound platform No. 4.
Today, the remains of the low-floor platform still exist to the north of the Kurama-bound platform No. 4.
Today, the remains of the low-floor platform still exist to the north of the Kurama-bound Platform 4.

sen.j: 1951年（昭和26年）7月1日 当駅～八瀬駅間が再複線化。
sen.e: On July 1, 1951, the line between the Takaragaike Station and the Yase Station became a double track again.
On July 1, 1951, the line between Takaragaike Station and Yase Station became a double track again.
July 1, 1951: The line between this station and Yase Station became a double track again.

sen.j: 1954年（昭和29年）6月10日 駅名を山端駅から宝ヶ池駅に変更。
sen.e: On June 10, 1954, the station name was changed from the Yamabana Station to the Takaragaike Station.
On June 10, 1954, the station name was changed from Yamabana Station to Takaragaike Station.
June 10, 1954: The station name was changed from Yamabana Station to Takaragaike Station.

sen.j: 1955年（昭和30年）9月1日 この日限りで京都市電の乗り入れ運転を終了。
sen.e: On September 1, 1955, the entry of the Kyoto City Trams ended.
On September 1, 1955, the entry of Kyoto City Trams was closed.
September 1, 1955: The entry of Kyoto City Trams was closed.

sen.j: 1958年（昭和33年）4月9日 当駅～岩倉駅 (京都府)間が再複線化。
sen.e: On April 9, 1958, the line between the Takagaraike Station and the Iwakura Station (Kyoto Prefecture) became a double track again.
On April 9, 1958, the line between Takagaraike Station and Iwakura Station (Kyoto Prefecture) became a double track again.
April 9, 1958: The line between this station and Iwakura Station (Kyoto Prefecture) became a double track again.

sen.j: 1986年（昭和61年）4月1日 会社譲渡により叡山電鉄の駅となる。
sen.e: On April 1, 1986, the station came to be owned by the Eizan Electric Railway as a result of transfer of companies.
On April 1, 1986, the station came under the ownership of the Eizan Electric Railway due to the transfer of companies.
April 1, 1986: The station came under the ownership of the Eizan Electric Railway due to the transfer of companies.
